dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Hmm… Sothis… Yes, that is it. My name is Sothis. And I am also called…The Beginning. But who once called me that?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Sothis?

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: I was not able to recall my name…until just now. And just like that, it came to me. How odd. That look upon your face… Did you think me a child? A mere child who forgot her own name?! Phooey! That “child” just saved your life! And what does that make you?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I am no child.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Ha! Such arrogance. You look the part but are you truly an adult?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I'm less than a child?

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Correct! You understand.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: You threw yourself before an axe to save just one young girl. Yet all is well, as I have stalled the flow of time for now. You would have died had I not intervened.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: There now. Is gratitude so much to ask? I did deem you worth saving, after all.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: You stopped time?

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Hm. I do not hear your gratitude. Perhaps I should force you to leave?  There now. Is gratitude so much to ask? I did deem you worth saving, after all.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Though it is only momentary, time has stopped. However did I manage that...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What will happen when time resumes?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What now?

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: When time begins again, the axe will tear into your flesh, and you will surely meet your end. How rude of you to drag me into this! Now what to do…

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Turn back the hands of time.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Of course! I must turn back the hands of time!

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Keep time frozen until I'm safe.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: That is ridiculous! Oh, but perhaps... Of course! I must turn back the hands of time!

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I'll just stay here and wait to die.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: As though I could stand idly by and watch that come to pass! Oh, but perhaps... Of course! I must turn back the hands of time!

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Yes... I do believe it can be done. You really are quite troublesome. I cannot wind back time too far, but all is well. You are aware of what’s to come, which means you can protect yourself this time. Now, go… Yes, you who bears the flames within. Drift through the flow of time to find the answers that you seek…

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: Hey. Time to wake up.

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: Were you having that dream again?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I was dreaming about a war...

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: Massive armies clashing on a vast field, right? There hasn’t been a battle like that in over three centuries…

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I was dreaming about a young girl...

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: You’ve described her to me before. I don’t think I’ve ever met anyone like that.

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: In any case, just put that out of your mind for now. The battlefield is no place for idle thoughts. Risking your life is part of the job for mercenaries like us. Letting your mind wander is a sure way to get yourself killed.

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: OK, time to get moving. Our next job is in the Kingdom. I told you before. It’s far from here, so we’ll need to leave at dawn.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Oh, right...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Of course.

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: Hm? Good grief. Everyone is already waiting for us outside.

intro.speaker: Mercenary
intro.line: Jeralt! Sir! Sorry to barge in, but your presence is needed.

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: What's happened?

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Please forgive our intrusion. We wouldn’t bother you were the situation not dire.

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: What do a bunch of kids like you want at this hour?

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: We’re being pursued by a group of bandits. I can only hope that you will be so kind as to lend your support.

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: Bandits? Here?

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: It's true. They attacked us while we were at rest in our camp.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: We’ve been separated from our companions and we’re outnumbered. They’re after our lives…not to mention our gold.

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: I’m impressed you’re staying so calm considering the situation. I… Wait. That uniform…

intro.speaker: Mercenary
intro.line: Bandits spotted just outside the village! Damn… There are a lot of them.

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: I guess they followed you all the way here. We can’t abandon this village now. Come on, let’s move. Hope you’re ready.

battle.speaker: Kostas
battle.line: Damn. Why are there mercenaries in the village? Guess we'll have to deal with them too.

boss.speaker: Kostas
boss.line: I'm gonna kill you where you stand...

boss.speaker: Kostas
boss.line: What the?! Aren't you Jeralt the Blade Breaker? What's a renowned mercenary like you doing here?

boss.speaker: Jeralt
boss.line: I'm the one who should be complaining. I'm caught up in the mess you started!

boss.speaker: Kostas
boss.line: Hey, you with the blank stare! Outta my way!

end.speaker: Jeralt
end.line: Hey... Did you just...

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: The Knights of Seiros are here! We'll cut you down for terrorizing our students. Hey, the thieves are running away! Go after them! The students seem to be unharmed. And...who's this?

end.speaker: Jeralt
end.line: Ugh... Why him?

end.speaker: Event
end.line: An Unexpected Reunion

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Captain Jeralt?! It is you! Goodness, it’s been ages. Don’t you recognize me? It’s Alois! Your old right-hand man! Well, that’s how I always thought of myself anyway. It must have been 20 years ago that you went missing without a trace. I always knew you were still alive!

end.speaker: Jeralt
end.line: You haven’t changed a bit, Alois. Just as loud as ever. And drop that “captain” nonsense. I’m not your captain anymore. These days I’m just a wandering mercenary. One who has work to do. Good-bye, old friend.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Right... Good-bye, Captain. Wait! That isn't how this ends. I insist that you return to the monastery with me!

end.speaker: Jeralt
end.line: Garreg Mach Monastery... I suppose this was inevitable.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: And how about you, kid? Are you the captain's child?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: He is a stranger to me.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Great sense of humor, this one. Clearly cut from the same cloth as the captain.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'm a bandit.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Great sense of humor, this one. Clearly cut from the same cloth as the captain.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: That is correct.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Is that so? Well, physical differences aside, your mannerisms do remind me of the captain.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: I'd love for you to see the monastery too. You will join me, won't you?

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: What's troubling you, Captain? You aren't about to run off again, are you?

end.speaker: Jeralt
end.line: Even I wouldn't dare run from the Knights of Seiros.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: The Knights of Seiros... They do seem rather skilled.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Ah. It seems your presence is required. Get going!

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: I appreciate your help back there. Your skill is beyond question. You’re clearly an experienced mercenary. And your father...that would be Jeralt, the Blade Breaker? Former captain of the Knights of Seiros. Oft praised as the strongest knight to ever live. Have I missed anything?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The Knights of Seiros?

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: You haven’t heard of the Knights of Seiros? The most famous order of knights in all of Fódlan?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I didn't know he was a captain.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: How curious. I’d wager the explanation for that is fascinating indeed.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Hey! You are coming with us to the monastery, right? Of course you are. I’d love to bend your ear as we travel. Oh, I should mention that the three of us are students of the Officers Academy at Garreg Mach Monastery. We were doing some training exercises when those bandits attacked. I definitely got the worst of it.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: That would be because you ran off.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Too true! I was the first to make a strategic retreat. Everything would have worked out if these two hadn’t followed me and ruined everything. Because of them, every single one of those bandits chased after us. Utterly ridiculous.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Ah, so that’s what you were thinking, Claude. And here I thought you were acting as a decoy for the sake of us all.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: His intentions were as clear as day. You will prove a lacking ruler if you cannot see the truth behind a person's words.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Hm. You will prove a lacking ruler if you look for deceit behind every word and fail to trust those whom you rely on.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Oh, joy. A royal debate between Their Highnesses. I wonder how being completely predictable affects one’s ability to wield power. Personally, as the embodiment of distrust, I’d say your little exchange smacks of naiveté.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Me? Naïve? Tell me, are you actually incapable of keeping quiet, or is your lack of self-awareness a condition of some sort?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: In any case, forgive our digression. I must speak with you, if you can spare a moment. The way you held your ground against the bandits’ leader was captivating! You never lost control of the situation. It showed me I still have much to learn.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Your skill is precisely why I must ask you to consider lending your services to the Empire. I might as well tell you now. I am no mere student. I am also the Adrestian Empire’s–

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Halt, Edelgard. Please allow me to finish my own proposition. The Holy Kingdom of Faerghus is in dire need of exceptional individuals such as yourself. Please, do consider returning to the Kingdom with me.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Whoa, there! You two sure are hasty. Trying to recruit someone you just met. Tactless, really. I was personally planning to develop a deep and lasting friendship on our journey back to the monastery before begging for favors. But it seems there’s no time for niceties in this world. So, capable stranger, let’s get right to it. Where does your allegiance lie?

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Hmm. It seems one's place of birth is quite significant to them. Yet they are so impressed by you, that you may take your pick. Well?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Adrestian Empire: Land of Ancient History

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: A wise choice. Though the Empire has fallen from its former glory, the other regions are merely offshoots that pale in comparison.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Holy Kingdom of Faerghus: Land of Noble Knights

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Understood. Faerghus is a noble and distinguished kingdom that has always valued chivalry.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Leicester Alliance: Burgeoning League of Nobles

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Is that right? Well, that’s a win for the Alliance, so I suppose I’m obligated to be happy.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: All right, that's enough with the small talk. It's time to head back to the monastery.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Looks like we'll have to pick this up another time.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: My, my. They are in such a hurry. You know... Each of the three is most unique.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Edelgard…

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Dimitri…

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Claude…

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Yes, I thought the same. I am so sleepy once again... I may be sleeping...but I...
